comment: Maybe it should be in base 16...

unless there are compelling reasons, throw something here instead of returning a message.\nI expect that if I get something it is something meaningful, not that I have to further parse the output to understand whether execution was ok.
it's not Roman format, if it is "in any base"
if (input < 0...) and "input must be greater than 0" are not the same thing. If you pass 0, you don't get the expected result - you just get an empty string
this is just me nitpicking but... wouldn't it be better to use a reverse-sorted SortedMap?
again, not greater than is different from less of. 0 is managed, so it should be a greater or equal than

make it clearer. the '0' is ascii #48, while the -10+'A' is 55. Maybe it would make sense to set them up as variables outside of a loop, something like\nint startingOffsetIfRepresentableAsDigit = 48; //48 is ascii for '0'\nint startingOffsetForAlphabetic = 55; //55 = 65 (ascii for A) - 10 (because 0->9 are covered by simple digit)
don't really like this name.. it's not "singleDigit", it's more "viewableAsDigit"
